body: As requested by @iphydf in https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/131#issuecomment-248998906 Supersedes TokTok/c-toxcore#131 CC: @JFreegman @iphydf @cleverca22 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335)

*[toxcore/Messenger.h, line 276 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335#-KZ8Sx0EVajfOQim-MRI:-KZ8Sx0FunsumIRn9Nn0:b1py3mo) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a279d2078e56bb4448fdb53446242d50d953b43f/toxcore/Messenger.h#L276)):*
> ```objc
> 
>     bool loop_run;
>     void (*loop_begin_cb)(struct Messenger *tox, void *user_data);
> ```

Change these to Messenger *m for consistency.

---

*[toxcore/tox.c, line 477 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335#-KZ8N-hpQd57OSgaonCh:-KZ8N-hqcuCiMiy7LcpS:b3v8oig) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a279d2078e56bb4448fdb53446242d50d953b43f/toxcore/tox.c#L477)):*
> ```C
>  * Gathers a list of every network FD activity is expected on
>  * @param sockets an array of size tox_fd_count().
>  */
> ```

1. No reason to abbreviate FD. 
2. What is the max_sockets param?
3. What does this function return?

---

*[toxcore/tox.c, line 489 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335#-KZ8PdcdBMpeHUAIz96p:-KZ8Pdcfq1b86S7x8lvG:b-9l5vor) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a279d2078e56bb4448fdb53446242d50d953b43f/toxcore/tox.c#L489)):*
> ```C
>         sock_t *tmp_sockets = (sock_t *) realloc(*sockets, fdcount * sizeof(sock_t));
> 
>         if (tmp_sockets != NULL) {
> ```

I'm not sure if I like the idea of realloc() failing silently. It's fine for now, but it's very easy to mess up.

---

*[toxcore/tox.c, line 503 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335#-KZ8OV_MIWKlpgaP1Vkp:-KZ8OV_MIWKlpgaP1Vkq:b-y16mdt) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/a279d2078e56bb4448fdb53446242d50d953b43f/toxcore/tox.c#L503)):*
> ```C
>     TCP_Connections *conns = m->net_crypto->tcp_c;
> 
>     for (i = 0; i < conns->tcp_connections_length; i++) {
> ```

Just a style suggestion: Put the 'if max_sockets == 0' clause in the loop condition.

*[configure.ac, line 508 at r16](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/335#-KbX5JMkeuGM05EoPN_f:-KbX5JMlBAsE1htUFHLd:budccu5) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/d53e3300fe35c27dda0a046b9057afb42b970a56/configure.ac#L508)):*
> ```M4Sugar
> fi
> 
> if test "x$LIBEV" = "xno" && test "x$LIBEVENT" = "xyes" -o "x$LIBEVENT" = "xauto"; then
> ```

The "no" check becomes obsolete if you add the sanity check code as I suggested above. I think there should not be any automatism here, because both libraries are disabled by default and need to be explicitly enabled by the user.

Now, next caveat: libev does not have pkg-config (at least not on Fedora 25), but libevent does.  There's also a libevent_pthreads.pc available. I would check if there is a pkg-config configuration for it, if yes - use it, and resort to manual checks only if a pkg-config configuration could not be found. My rationale is, that on distros that provide a proper configuration for it, the flags might be "better" than the ones we specify. And on ones that don't, like on MinGW that has no pkg-config - we'll just try and do our best.
